results.title: Sunshine [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Serendipity Point Films, Andras Hamori, Robert Lantos and Istvan Szabo
results.brief_description: Sunshine is an epic drama that follows the lives of three generations of Hungarian Jews from the late 18th century to the 19th century. Ralph Fiennes plays three different roles in this film which begins with the Grandfather developing a tonic that becomes the family’s fortune. The family will experience much pain and heartbreak, mostly due to the invasion of the Nazi’s and some family members conversion from Jewish to Catholic - events that could lead to a family’s demise. “Sunshine” shows how determination and courage can unite a family through struggle and ensure the survival of future generations.

results.title: Sunset Boulevard
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Charles Brackett and Billy Wilder
results.brief_description: This scathing film about Hollywood morality stars William Holden as an aspiring screenwriter who becomes a gigolo for fading movie Goddess, Norma Desmond (Gloria Swanson). A beauty of the silent screen she now remains isolated in her Los Angeles mansion, remembering the days when her fame was celebrated throughout the world. With a cynical, erudite script and some of Wilder’s best direction, “Sunset Boulevard” is a classic about the decay of Hollywood’s Golden Age. As the central character willing to prostitute himself in order to succeed, Holden is excellent but it is Swanson who gives one of the screen’s greatest performances as the demented, dangerous Norma. Her final scene is unforgettable.

results.title: Sunrise: a song of two humans
results.creator_credit: Fox Film Corporation, William Fox and Friedrich W. Murnau
results.brief_description: The first intertitle declares “This song of the Man and his Wife is of no place and every place; you might hear it anywhere and at anytime”. This is true of the film as it is a timeless tale of love and redemption. Tempted by a femme fatale, the Man, a poor farmer, is seduced by the idea of murdering his wife to run off to the city with the object of his adulterous love. Academy Award winning, classic silent cinema from German director F.W. Murnau, his first American production. Screenplay by Carl Mayer. Digitally restored and remastered with the original and an alternative new soundtrack, as well as other special features on two discs. Cast includes George O’Brien, Janet Gaynor, Margaret Livingston.

results.title: Sunless = Sans Soleil
results.brief_description: An unknown woman reads and comments upon letters she receives from a friend, a freelance cameraman who travels around the world. The cameraman asks himself, and his colleagues, what is the point of describing the world like this when he is always its instrument, and what part does memory, which he helps to create, play?

results.title: Sunday Too Far Away
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Gil Brealey, Matt Carroll and Ken Hannam
results.brief_description: One of the few Australian feature films in which the narrative is centred on the portrayal of workers on the job - a group of shearers working on an outback station in 1955 in the months leading to the nine months shearers’ strike. While the gun shearer played by Jack Thompson is the central character, the focus of this episodic and unsentimental drama is on the communal values of the group rather than on those of the individual. Cinemaphotography by Geoff Burton. Cast also includes Max Cullen, Peter Cummins, John Ewart, John Hargreaves, Sean Scully, Ken Shorter, Gregory Apps.

results.title: Sunday bloody Sunday
results.creator_credit: Vectia Films, Joseph Janni and John Schlesinger
results.brief_description: Glenda Jackson, a career woman separated from her husband, and Peter Finch, a Jewish doctor, are caught in a love triangle with a young bisexual designer. Although the arrangement appears ideal, the trio must deal with the jealousy, fear and self doubt they encounter. This absorbing character study, originally shocking, is regarded as a forerunner of cinema’s increasingly mature treatment of homosexuality. Also stars Peggy Ashcroft.

results.title: Summerfield [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Clare Beach Films, Patricia Lovell and Ken Hannam
results.brief_description: When a newcomer arrives in a small, secluded town to discover that the former teacher has disappeared, he probes into the mystery and becomes more and more intrigued by the inhabitants of a forbidding house called Summerfield. Eventually, the secrets of Summerfield are revealed in a dramatic ending with a shock twist. Directed by Ken Hannam (director of “Sunday Too Far Away”) and starring, Nick Tate, Elizabeth Alexander and John Waters, “Summerfield” was shot on location at Victoria’s Phillip and Churchill Islands.

results.title: Summer with Monika = Sommaren med Monika
results.creator_credit: Svensk Filmindustri, Allan Ekelund and Ingmar Bergman
results.brief_description: When Harry (Lars Ekborg) meets Monika (Harriet Andersson) in a cafe they soon fall in love. Monika leaves home after an argument with her father and the young lovers run away on Harry’s father’s boat. They spend a carefree summer on the boat until Monika discovers she is pregnant and they are forced to return to Stockholm. As a married couple struggling to make a living Harry and Monika soon find their love disintegrating. Once again, Ingmar Bergman totally engrosses us in this sensitive study of young love, eliciting great performances from Lars Ekborg as the ernest Harry and Harriet Andersson as the wild and willful Monika. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: Summer of Sam
results.creator_credit: Touchstone, 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks, Jon Kilik and Spike Lee
results.brief_description: Set in New York City in the summer of 1977, “Summer of Sam” examines the effects of a massive heatwave on the city as well as the paranoia and fear created by the random serial murders committed by a psychopath who only signed himself, Son of Sam. But though the serial killer plot sets the film in motion, “Summer of Sam” is about much much more, for it is in 1977 when the emerging anarchism of the punk movement collided with the hedonism of the disco era. The hunt for the Son of Sam is merged with the story of two couples: Vinny (John Leguizamo) and Diona (Mira Sorvino), a married Italo-American couple whose relationship is threatened by Vinny’s guilt-stricken affairs; and Ritchie (Aidrien Brody) and Gloria (Jennifer Esposito), two outcasts - he because he refuses to fit the macho stereotypes of the Italian culture, she because of her “slutty” past - who both find acceptance in the growing punk scene of downtown New York. By focussing his camera on the world of working-class Italo-Americans, Spike Lee is not abandoning his commitment to examining American racism. Instead, by accurately representing a segment of the white world in a specific historic and cultural moment, Lee reveals the underlying racism, misogyny and narrow-mindedness of American mass culture. Being a Spike Lee joint, the film is also a wonderful celebration of music, both disco and punk, as well as a sophisticated examination of love and marriage, and bisexuality. Fast-paced, with excellent art design and a superb score, “Summer of Sam” emerges as a bittersweet love poem to the city of New York: its clubs and its porn theatres, its residents black and white, its uptown charms and its downtown sleaze. A contender for the most underrated film of recent times.

results.title: Summer interlude = Sommarlek
results.brief_description: Summer interlude is Bergman’s poignant and lyrical study of young love. A young ballerina, Mari, falls in love with a fellow student (Henrik) and thy spend an idyllic summer together on an island near Stockholm where Mari lives unhappily with her uncle and his mistress. But the affair comes to a sudden and tragic end when Henrik is killed in an accident. Several years pass and Mari is now a prima ballerina, but still devastated and heartbroken by the loss. Bitter and without emotion she meets a young journalist, David) who has found the diary she wrote while Henrik was alive. The diary reawakens long dormant feelings and she gradually accepts David’s company and sets out to find a new happiness. This is Bergman’s first mature film and is a peotic evocation of the burden of memory and loss. In Swedish with English subtitles.
